The ESRAG Rotary Great Britain & Ireland Chapter looks back at the time after its foundation in February 2020. Here are their highlights: 👨👨👧👦 Membership growth: We quadrupled our chapter's membership to nearly 120, with ESRAG's global membership now at an impressive 1600+. And the best part is, everyone can join. Join us now! https://lnkd.in/gZJPb38M 🌍 Shaping global presence: We hosted influential speakers, delivered presentations worldwide, ignited discussions, provoked change, and initiated local and regional projects in critical areas such as #biodiversity, #food, #pollution, #climate solutions, and #circulareconomy. 7️⃣ Strategic planning: Our task forces on crucial issues like clean #cooking, plant-rich #diets, and planetary #boundaries played a significant role in Rotary International's decision to add "Protecting the Environment" as its 7th Area of Focus. This is a testament to our collective dedication and impact. 🏁 Significant collaborations: We prepared the Rotary delegation for #COP26 in Glasgow, a milestone moment, and as we look ahead, the next climate talks are on the horizon. 👑 Generation change: Three years after Malc Rooney and Kirsten Weber co-chaired the chapter, Chris Davies and Mohammad Alramahi now succeed them. Kirsten says, 'Being part of the ESRAG movement has been a labor of love, and I'm very proud of the progress we've made, particularly in Great Britain and Ireland. All of this has been made possible through the incredible dedication, enthusiasm, and support of our members and partners; you are the driving force propelling us forward. Let's continue to champion environmental sustainability and work towards a better future for our planet!' 🌱 🌳 #sustainability #environment #Rotary

♻️ The transition to a green economy is important for Ukraine's effective recovery and requires comprehensive solutions and close cooperation and coordination between different stakeholders, as well as clear plans and programs. In an article for Yevgeniya Afanasenko, a member of the Association of Sustainable Development Experts and Principal Environmental Advisor at EBRD, spoke about the priorities of Ukraine's green recovery and why it is worth investing in a carbon-free economy. We recommend reading the article: https://lnkd.in/eVshmifC ✅ Ms. Afanasenko is a moderator of the 6th panel of the International Sustainability Forum 2023, where together with leading speakers we will discuss Ukraine's transition to a green economy and the path to decarbonization.

Europe Day, celebrated annually on May 9th, commemorates the historic Schuman Declaration of 1950, which proposed the creation of a unified European community, laying the foundation for the European Union. 🌏 In the context of sustainability, Europe Day serves as a reminder of the EU's commitment to environmental stewardship and sustainable development. Across the continent, initiatives promoting renewable energy, biodiversity conservation, waste reduction, and climate action are integral parts of EU policies and frameworks. Europe's ambitious targets, such as the European Green Deal and the Paris Agreement commitments, 📜 underscore its determination to transition towards a greener, more sustainable future. Through collaborative efforts, 🤝 innovative technologies, and proactive legislation, Europe strives to lead the global fight against climate change while fostering economic prosperity and social equity for current and future generations. 💚

#EUClimatePact #MyWorldOurPlanet 🌍 News from the #EUClimatePact Community in #Greece. Check out the activities commencing on April 1st, 2024, as part of our ongoing commitment to inspire local #ClimateAction 🌱 𝗚𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗻𝗕𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀.𝗴𝗿: Starting in April 2024, a dedicated Climate Pact column will host a climate article written by our country Ambassadors! 📻 𝗥𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗼 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗹 𝟭 𝗣𝗶𝗿𝗮𝗲𝘂𝘀 𝟵𝟬.𝟰 𝗙𝗠 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗢𝗻𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗥𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗼: This is a biweekly activity in which Ambassadors will present and discuss climate topics! 📺 𝗢𝗻𝗖𝗮𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗮.𝗴𝗿: Join us bimonthly for in-depth conversations with Ambassadors, experts, activists, and community leaders driving change towards a more sustainable Greece. 👥 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗽𝘀: Ambassadors join forces and work collectively to promote change! The Working Group thematics include Climate and Local Authorities, Climate—Health and Food, Climate—students and Academia, Climate and the Role of Enterprises, Climate Justice and Diplomacy, Green Deal, and Digital Transition. Here is an indicative list of the topics and themes to be addressed under the activities: ❕ Strategic Planning for Smart, Sustainable and Resilient Cities & Regions ❕ Sustainability Reporting (local & regional authorities) ❕ Circular economy for a sustainable society ❕ Green and ecological technologies for waste management ❕ Sustainable Waste Management and the Circular Economy ❕ Energy labelling and eco-design of products ❕ Climate Neutrality in Greek Cities ❕ Drinking Water Management and Water Scarcity in Greece Right of Transition ❕ The Impact of Climate Change on Public Health ❕ The Impact of Aviation on the Environment and Human Health ❕ Climate Change and Islands. the Impact of Climate Change on the Island Tourism Economy ❕ Youth Empowerment and Sustainable Education ❕ Partnerships for a Greener Future - Decision-Making Stay tuned for more announcements!!

𝐋𝐞𝐭’𝐬 𝐜𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐛𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞… 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐥𝐚𝐮𝐧𝐜𝐡 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝟏𝐭.𝐨𝐫𝐠 𝐄𝐮𝐫𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐚𝐧 𝐂𝐡𝐚𝐩𝐭𝐞𝐫 🥳🎉 ➡️ 1t.org is the World Economic Forum's "trillion trees" platform, created to support the United Nations Decade for Ecosystem Restoration 2021-2030, with the aim of conserving, restoring and growing one trillion trees during this decade. 🌍 Following its success supporting multi-stakeholder in priority regions across North America, China, India and the Sahel’s Great Green Wall, 1t.org launched it's new European Chapter last week. Hosted by Salesforce Paris, the Chapter will focus on the conservation and restoration of European ecosystems at a landscape-level to support resilient and thriving European forests. It will also focus on facilitating structured public-private partnerships (PPPs) to support coordinated restoration at scale. 🗣️ Reforest'Action, represented by its CEO and founder Stéphane Hallaire as the Chair of the Secretariat, will have several missions, notably: ➡️ Raising awareness and mobilizing private sector pledges and investment for restoration in Europe; ➡️ Facilitating multi-stakeholder dialogue to unlock bottlenecks and facilitate structured Public-Private Partnerships; ➡️ Empower a new generation of European ecopreneurs. Reforest’Action will work closely with the World Economic Forum throughout the whole European Chapter. This is a big step for our forests and we are proud to contribute to this event! florian vernaz, Head of 1t.org Tillem Burlace, Regional Lead, 1t.org, Europe/Africa John Dutton, Head of UpLink Arthur Pasquier, Climate Coordinator, Bouygues SA Julie Ravillon, Sustainability Leader, Salesforce France #sustainabledevelopment #sustainability #event #climatechange #NbS

Resonance Managing Director of Impact Advisory Peter J. Hall will be a key roundtable speaker at the December 4 #COP28 side event at the Benelux -- European Investment Bank (EIB) Pavilion: "Supporting Adaptation of Coastal Cities – First Investment of The Urban Resilience Fund B (TURF).” This immersive presentation will examine innovative adaptation strategies designed for #coastal cities via the case study of a new project -- the first investment of TURF into a public-private company aimed at protecting Mauritania's capital city of Nouakchott from coastal erosion and flooding, while introducing new activities to the benefit of its communities. This innovative project will be implemented by a dedicated public-private company, the Société d'Aménagement du Littoral de Nouakchott (SALN), in which TURF, managed by Meridiam, will invest equally alongside the Mauritanian Government. Learn how innovative financing support of partnership efforts and solutions can help coastal communities address adaptation and resilience. The event will be moderated by Sharin Wheeler, Principal Advisor Communications, EIB, and will include alongside Peter esteemed roundtable panelists: Thierry Déau - Meridiam CEO Messori Milena - Head of Division at EIB Rogier van den Berg - Global Director, WRI Ross Center for Sustainable Cities Stelios Grafakos - Principal Economist Global Green Growth Institute 💻 For those who would like to watch the event, the European Investment Bank (EIB) will be livestreaming via its YouTube Channel: https://lnkd.in/gcMYEneX #cop28 #cop28uae #coastalresilience #climateresilience #climateadaptation #mauritania
